comments:
Driver:  TPTP-4.2.0-200604031056

- Create an embedded cloudscape DB as specified in the help contents
- Try to import the apache access log file that I have attached

In my case, I got the error dialog that I have attached.

Created an attachment (id=37736)
Apache Access Log

Created an attachment (id=37738)
Workspace log file
Transferring to Platform project component that owns Large Log Support.
Marius, please take a look at this asap

Works fine for me. 
Make sure the database is created in the working directory of the workbench.

I was able to consistently reproduce this on my machine and on Amy's machine using cloudscpe 10.1 and a recent driver.  This problem is not only limited to embedded cloudscape.  It also happens when DB2 is used.

I'm sure that this is something that worked fine with privious versions of TPTP.
I used the apache access log file attached to verify the existance of the problem.

By the way, here's the stack trace I'm getting in the log view:

I will move this to i3, the problem should go away once Bug 135564 will be fixed.

I reduce the severity of this bug, to normal and move it to i3.
can't be moved to i3 if it blocks a testcase

The exception will not occur with the fix from 135564

Moving to i3 for more investigation on some other scenarios that can make this exception happen

Large log support now works for DB2 but it still fails with embedded cloudscape.  Here's the message that I'm getting:

An error occurred while attempting to import the log file d:\temp\apache_access.log.
  IWAT0353E Common Base Event logging agent outputter AdapterStaticParserOutputterID1 cannot write to agent unknown due to the following exception: The statement was aborted because it would have caused a duplicate key value in a unique or primary key constraint or unique index identified by 'SQL051027004802620' defined on 'CBEDefaultElement'.
Try again with a fresh database. Please let me know if it still doesn't work.
It works with a freshly generated database.  You can close this defect if you don't need to use it to check-in code.
